div.p: Well I started at the age of 22, yeah 22, a year after I lost my dad I went to work for The Prince’s Trust as a volunteer on a 12 week programme
just to sort of steer myself away from all my mates and what I was involved in on the streets so I started The Prince’s Trust
and I was able to do the 12 week programme and then my youth worker at the time who started to be a bit more involved in my life
came to me and said “have you thought about doing the ABC Youth Work Diploma?” Over the space of 6 months
I had the opportunity to take over a youth club and my line manager at the time said to me “we’re only giving you this position as manager
on the grounds that you pass your ABC Diploma” and I was like “yeah I’m half way through it I’m going to finish it”
but got into the job and then sort of put the ABC Diploma to the back burner and then I had a letter 6 months later
to say if you don’t complete this in the next 3 months we will have to degrade you back down to a volunteer youth worker
so I’m really glad that happened so yeah but again I found it very difficult because of my disability with my dyslexia and I had
a lot of support, I had a learning mentor who supported me through the theory side of things but then the actual final part
of the course was to do a presentation on a project and I did it on a girls’ football team that I set up called the Star 66 Girls
and that was the sort of nail in the coffin where he said the presentation and the format and how I delivered it was one of the
best that they’d seen for a long time so I felt good about that but putting things on pen and paper and things like that is
literally just going into a place that I really don’t like so I was glad to pass the presentation was probably one of the best
times of my life getting that certificate passed me to say now I’m a qualified youth worker but the training and things like that
was very, it was a place I didn’t want to be as much as people are very focused on qualifications and Degrees and Masters
and Diplomas and stuff I think what I’ve got is life skills and I think that’s things you can’t read from a textbook.
